docs.lead_paragraph: Public health agencies and drug treatment centers nationwide are scrambling to battle an explosive increase in cases of hepatitis C, a scourge they believe stems at least in part from a surge in intravenous heroin use.

headline.main: Hepatitis Increasingly Goes Hand in Hand With Heroin Abuse
headline.print_headline: Hepatitis Increasingly Goes Hand in Hand With Heroin Abuse

docs.snippet: Public health agencies and drug treatment centers nationwide are scrambling to battle an explosive increase in cases of hepatitis C, a scourge they believe stems at least in part from a surge in intravenous heroin use.

docs.lead_paragraph: North Carolina's largest health insurer says higher-than-anticipated costs after two years of selling federally subsidized coverage has forced it to seek premium increases even greater than it thought would be necessary two months ago.

headline.main: Blue Cross Raises Rate Hike Sought on Affordable Care Plans
headline.print_headline: Blue Cross Raises Rate Hike Sought on Affordable Care Plans

docs.snippet: North Carolina's largest health insurer says higher-than-anticipated costs after two years of selling federally subsidized coverage has forced it to seek premium increases even greater than it thought would be necessary two months ago.

headline.main: Answers About Campus Depression and Suicide Risk Among College Students

docs.abstract: An article about campus pressures, depression and suicide promoted a flurry of questions from readers. New York Times reporter Julie Scelfo offers a selection of questions and answers about the issue.
docs.snippet: An article about campus pressures, depression and suicide promoted a flurry of questions from readers. New York Times reporter Julie Scelfo offers a selection of questions and answers about the issue.
